- the bread at the beginning is super tasty and makes you want more - the pizza is delicious and comes in personal sizes , however be warned that the peter 's favourite pizza with prosciutto and baby arugula is actually a margarite pizza with cold prosciutto and baby arugula on top , like a salad .

lahore is a great place to duck into late-night when you need some really tasty food on the cheap -- you 'll likely have trouble finishing the amount of food you get for four dollars .
there is a downside if you 're ordering in -- the delivery guys have major attitude .
i do n't usually order wine with indian so i ca n't comment on their wine list or their wines .
i highly recommend caviar russe to anyone who wants delicious top grade caviar and fantastic service .
the food , served in small tasting portions ( as an option ) is very good with each dish being better than the next .
from beginning appetizers , the scallops were incredible , to the delicious chocolate souffle with rasberry mint sorbet , we were delighted by the taste sensations .
aspect: chocolate souffle with rasberry mint sorbet

text: if you 're looking for perfect traditional sushi , go here - if you 're looking for interesting combinations , try sushi of gari 's ( east side ) .
this place has good potential , but needs a significant amount of work before we can justify spending that much money on indian food you can get everywhere else .

though you will undoubtedly be seated at a table with what seems like barely enough room ( no matter what the size of your party ) , the warm atomosphere is worth the cramped quarters you 'll have fun and forgot about the tight spot you 're in .
it can not be the ambience , because the place is very cramped and some guests have to sit in an aisle .
otherwise , this place has great service and prices and a nice friendly atmosphere .
each table has a pot of boiling water sunken into its surface , and you get platters of thin sliced meats , various vegetables , and rice and glass noodles .
although the tables may be closely situated , the candle-light , food quality and service overcompensate .
the waiters are sweet , the food is tasty and the bill is never too large .
the staff is also attentive and friendly .
the buffet had a nice selection .
great place to go for a drink too because they have 100 kinds of beer .
plus , when our entrees were held up in the kitchen on a busy saturday night , the owner sent over complimentary summer rolls to hold us over !
try green curry with vegetables .
i fell in love with the egg noodles in the beef broth with shrimp dumplings and slices of bbq roast pork .
aspect: egg noodles in the beef broth with shrimp dumplings and slices of bbq roast pork

text: the waitress was very patient with us and the food is phenomenal !
we ran a little late for the reservation but it was n't a problem to get our table immediately .
as soon as my father lifted his pen from the check a chef appeared to usher us out .
the food was amazing , the service was so attentive and personable , and how about that ambience !
it is a lot of fun with live entertainment and all kinds of disney type special effects .
the place is a bistro which means : simple dishes and wine served efficiently in a bustling atmosphere .
interesting selection , good wines , service fine , fun decor .
